intro: Ardisia cadieri, commonly known as the Christmas berry, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, red berries that appear in the winter season. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its flowers are small and white or pink, clustered in umbels. The berries are toxic to humans but serve as an important food source for certain wildlife species.
